definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Baloney. He's usually in bed by now.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，到現在這個鐘點，他已經上牀睡覺了。

sentences.english: According to the regulations of Ministry of Education, hourly payment is based on the actual teaching hours.
sentences.chinese: 授課鐘點費依教育部規定按實際授課時數覈實支給。

sentences.english: It’s no longer required of you to work for the rest of your life to get paid by the hour, on the hour.
sentences.chinese: 你不會再被要求在你的餘生打鐘點工。

sentences.english: I go home at a quarter to two.
sentences.chinese: 我回家在差一刻鐘點兩。

sentences.english: It is said that that hour is the Imperial Palace gloom heaviest time.
sentences.chinese: 據說，那個鐘點是故宮陰氣最重的時刻。

sentences.english: Wang run early in the city, she did four households part-time one day.
sentences.chinese: 王小早奔波在城市裏，她一天做四戶人家的鐘點工。

sentences.english: I thought of Lylian, the hour maid hired by my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我還想到了莉蓮，我父母僱的鐘點工。

sentences.english: I also thought about Lillian, our parents' part-time maid.
sentences.chinese: 我還想到了莉蓮，我父母僱的鐘點工。

sentences.english: To treat an illness to the father, she makes the hour labor to make money.
sentences.chinese: 爲了給父親治病，她做鐘點工賺錢。

sentences.english: If there were not the day and night, were not the time hours, mankind would return to the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 如果只有晝夜，沒有鐘點，人類將返回到原始社會。

sentences.english: The hours of those two exams conflict.
sentences.chinese: 那兩門測驗的鐘點互有牴觸。

sentences.english: There are two more hours before the sun sets and maybe he will come up before that.
sentences.chinese: 太陽下去還有兩個鐘點，也許不到那時魚就會浮上來。

sentences.english: Online hourly professionals are becoming a newly emerging job, the Daily Business reported.
sentences.chinese: 《每日商報》報道，網絡鐘點工正成爲一種新興職業。

sentences.english: They had twelve black hours before them; they regulated their employment accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 他們面前有十二個黑鐘點，足供他們安排利用。

sentences.english: It took us two hours to look over the new plant at Minhang.
sentences.chinese: 我們花了兩個鐘點時間參觀了閔行那家新工廠。

sentences.english: Many people are paid on an hourly basis.

definition: to make a bed/to lay bedding
to move one's base (of operations)/to reposition/to relocate
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
